meanings.definition: The quality or state of being incessant.
meanings.sent1: Her incessancies in studying paid off with excellent grades.
meanings.sent2: The incessancies of the rain made the day feel gloomy.
meanings.sent3: The incessancies of his jokes always brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The incessancies of the ticking clock echoed through the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The incessancies of the buzzing bees filled the garden with life.

meanings.definition: The fact or quality of being continuous or unceasing.
meanings.sent1: The incessancies of the waterfall created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent2: The incessancies of the traffic outside never seemed to end.
meanings.sent3: The incessancies of her laughter brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: The incessancies of time passing reminded him of his mortality.
meanings.sent5: The incessancies of the waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing.
